com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.util
Class NativeCapableUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.util.NativeCapableUtil

public class NativeCapableUtil
extends java.lang.Object

The NativeCapableUtil is a utility class used to get native information of native capable objects. This class is a shortcut to avoid casting the native object to NativeCapable and get the NativeStateManager object.

Author:
Jose M. Arranz Santamaria
See Also:
NativeCapable

Method Detail

isNativeCapable

public static boolean isNativeCapable(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if the specified object is native capable else returns false.

An object is native capable if implements the interface NativeCapable.

Parameters:
obj - the specified object.
Returns:
true if the object is native capable.

isNative

public static boolean isNative(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if the specified object is native else returns false.

An object is native if it is native capable and was made native.

Parameters:
obj - the specified object. Can not be null.
Returns:
true if the object is native capable.

getAddress

public static long getAddress(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns the native address of a native object.

Parameters:
obj - the specified native object. Can not be null.
Returns:
the native address.

sizeOf

public static long sizeOf(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns the native memory size of a native object.

Parameters:
obj - the specified native object. Can not be null.
Returns:
the native memory size.

isAttached

public static boolean isAttached(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if the native object is attached to native memory.

Parameters:
obj - the specified native object. Can not be null.
Returns:
true if object is attached, false if owns the native memory.
See Also:
NativeManager.makeNative(Object).

free

public static boolean free(java.lang.Object obj)
Frees the native object if owns its native memory.

If the specified object is not native it does nothing.

Current implementation calls NativeManager.free(Object).

Parameters:
obj - the specified native object. Can not be null.
Returns:
true is the object was native before calling.

detach

public static void detach(java.lang.Object obj)
Detaches the native object keeping its native memory. Current implementation calls NativeManager.detach(Object).

Parameters:
obj - the specified native object. Can not be null.

getBuffer

public static NativeBuffer getBuffer(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns the native buffer manager of a native object.

Parameters:
obj - the specified native object. Can not be null.
Returns:
the native buffer manager.

getNativeStateManager

public static NativeStateManager getNativeStateManager(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns the native state manager of a native capable object.

Parameters:
obj - the specified native capable object. Can not be null.
Returns:
the native state manager, if is not native returns null.

getNativeManager

public static NativeManager getNativeManager(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns the native manager managing a native object.

In the current implementation, the native manager is a singleton.

Parameters:
obj - the specified native object. Can not be null.
Returns:
the native manager, never is null.

isInsideTxn

public static boolean isInsideTxn(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if the specified native object is inside a native transaction.

Parameters:
obj - the specified native object. Can not be null.
Returns:
true if inside a transaction.

getType

public static TypeNative getType(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns the type declaration instance of a native capable object.

Parameters:
obj - the specified native capable object. Can not be null.
Returns:
the type declaration of specified object.
See Also:
NativeCapable.jnieasyGetType()

initializeClass

public static void initializeClass(java.lang.Class clasz)
A simple utility to ensure a java.lang.Class is initialized. The initialization of a user defined native capable class is necessary to self-register.

Current implementation is:

Class.forName(clasz.getName(),true,clasz.getClassLoader());

Parameters:
clasz - the specified Class.
